reviews.title: Great Place!
reviews.text: We stayed there 5 nights and found the place to be exceptionally clean, very warm and friendly owner (Mrs. Norbu) with a most efficient and accomodating staff. Felt like home. Had great views of the Himalayas. Extremely affordable,perfectly located. Great, sufficient breakfast included.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Get looked after in the comfort of Tibetan hospitality

reviews.text: Very warm welcome and homely atmosphere in this incredible Tibetan-run nest in Darjeeling. The management will plan and care for all your activities without being pushy and arrange the best price for yoyr budget. It's really a haven, with a cosy fire in the living room and a beautiful Lhasa Apso that greets every guest. Never have I stayed somewhere and felt so welcome. The owners are genuine and go out of their way to make you feel at ease. If on your way to Darjeeling, make sure you reserve early; this place is going to be incredibly popular and you will adore the food!
reviews.title: Fantastic family run hotel

likes.disliked: — steep flight of stairs to access reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my 6th trip to India (1st to Darjeeling) & I have stayed in everything from r/s 100 per night doss holes to opulent luxury hotels (where I got hassled every 5 minutes...)
reviews.title: Overrated

likes.liked: — hot water bottles in the beds
likes.disliked: — cold, musty, dirty carpets, construction noise and dust

reviews.text: Dekeling Hotel is fantastic. Sure there are some renovations going on in the lobby, but hey, renovations will be finished in a week or so, it didn't interfere with my stay at all.
reviews.title: A home away from home

likes.disliked: — Sometimes those stairs are a challenge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dekeling was a nice hotel but I didn't really see much of what the other visitors have ranted on about - having said that, it was probably because we were there for just 1 night (barely 20 hours due to severe train delays to NJP) so we probably didn't have enough time to experience it.
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel

reviews.text: Overall, I would still go back there, and it was pretty good value for money.
reviews.title: An incredible Gem in Darjeeling
Quaint accomodations in Darjeeling
reviews.text: ROOM - Room was spacious and functional - quite dated tbough and it was a "deluxe" room with views of the mountain - that was nice to have a view but the deluxe bit was what I didn't quite get as it was a bit dated.

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience at the Dekeling
reviews.text: The only thing I'd say is that you definitely need to rent a heater for R150 per night as the rooms are not heated and it was quite cold - pretty damn freezing, I'd say!! The good thing is that there's a heated sitting room where we all huddled round the fire, it's good as it makes you socialise with others instead of being stuck in our rooms.

SERVICE - given we only had 20 hours in Darjeeling, the hotel (the owner's son) offered a tour for us to see the major sites which we took advantage of and also offered us a taxi to take us back down to NJP - cheaper than what we paid on the way up so that was good. There was no hard sell at all - the price they charged was very reasonable and in that respect the service was really good.
reviews.title: Very attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in December 09 and had two different rooms.
reviews.title: overpriced - look elsewhere !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room was a good size and felt cosy and clean. However, we soon realised the following day that the bedroom was infested with ants. They were all over the bed, the bathroom etc. When i told the manager he said that he knew and that he had tried to get rid of them but because the hotel was wooden they wouldn't go away - so he remade the bed and the next unsuspecting customer got them.
reviews.title: Wonderful - but watch out for the stairs

reviews.text: Then our next room was a real treat. A floor lower down it was facing out onto the front, a little smaller than the last room. Upon stepping around the room it suddenly became obvious that the floor was a little unsteady. When we pulled the carpet back we realised why. There were broken floorboards and gaps where floorboards were missing - they had just covered the whole thing with the carpet. So, you had to watch where you stood etc. and hoped that the bed was secure enough.
reviews.title: simply the best

reviews.text: I wouldn't mind if this was a hotel at RS600 a night but it was RS1700 and came highly recommended in the Lonely Planet ?
reviews.title: A Special Place in Darjeeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a friend of saatha I am sorry the review written on title horrible for hotel Dekeling is totally wrong as my friend had never checked that hotel. I extremely sorry for the act of my friend.
reviews.title: Apologies

reviews.text: I got the cheapest room- up several floors and out of the way. It was clean with a terrific view of the town. Opening the windows allowed fog to roll in- refreshing! This part of the hotel had a shared bathroom. I had a little trouble figuring out how to work the water and had to go down several times for various reasons (no phone in room and no one coming up to see me). I was very pleased with the room and never even saw the others who had rooms on my floor. The service was not very good, probably due to the fact there were two flights of stairs between my room and the front desk (which was on the fifth floor). Happy climbing!
reviews.title: Pretty good price for satisfactory accommodations
horrible
reviews.text: stayed for two days . horrible experience.cold . no heting. bad service. not recommended

It's a trade off - the beds were horribly hard and the rooms were uninspiring, but the front desk service and hospitality were excellent. We visited Darjeeling immediately post-cyclone so it was slightly chaotic with intermittent electricity and water. I wasn't quite in agreement with the LP raves on the hotel, but it was relatively serviceable. Due to the cyclone we lost a reservation for the first night at the Dekeling and the family kindly offered up their other property, Hawk's Nest. The Hawk's Nest was considerably nicer and more charming. We had a 2 room suite with fireplaces, fabulous view, and wonderful home-cooked meals for approximately $20 USD more than the Hotel Dekeling. We should have stayed there the entire time. I would recommend "splurging" on Hawk's Nest if you are looking for something more interesting - although it is a bit further up the street, off the main tourist area (which I liked!).
reviews.title: Rooms were slightly overrated, yet service was excellent
Great hospitality
reviews.text: We were there for 2 days. It was really a good experience. Hotel Staff and service is excellent. I booked a room facing a nice view.One problem which i faced that there were two single beds in my room instead of one double bed.
